trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> objects.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class represents a collection of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension> objects associated with a certificate.
These extensions can provide additional information about the certificate.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> class.

Adds an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object to an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection.Add%2A> method allows duplicate elements to be added to the collection.

An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
The index at which the extension parameter was added.
The value of the extension parameter is `null`.
Copies a collection into an array starting at the specified index.
An array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> objects.
The location in the array at which copying starts.
index is a zero-length string or contains an invalid value.
index is `null`.
index specifies a value that is not in the range of the array.

Gets the number of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.

An integer representing the number of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
Enumerators allow read-only access to data in the collection and cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionEnumerator"></xref> object to use to iterate through the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is guaranteed to be thread safe.
This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information about this property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`true` if the collection is thread safe; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object at the specified index.

Use this property to get information about an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension> object when you know the location of the object in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection> object.
The location of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object.
index is less than zero.
index is equal to or greater than the length of the array.
Gets the first <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object whose value or friendly name is specified by an object identifier (OID).

Use this property to get information about an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension> object when you know the object identifier (OID) of the extension in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection> object.
The object identifier (OID) of the extension to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> object.
Gets an object that you can use to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
This property implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

The .NET Framework classes based on <xref:System.Array> provide their own synchronized version of the collection using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property.
Classes that use arrays can also implement their own synchronization using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property.

The synchronizing code must perform operations on the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property of the collection, not directly on the collection.
This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects.
Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection.
Note that some implementations of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection.SyncRoot%2A> might return the array itself.
Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.
An object that you can use to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
Copies the collection into an array starting at the specified index.
An array of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Extension"></xref> objects.
The location in the array at which copying starts.
index is a zero-length string or contains an invalid value.
index is `null`.
index specifies a value that is not in the range of the array.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
Enumerators allow read-only access to data in the collection and cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object to use to iterate through the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509ExtensionCollection"></xref> object.
